meanings.definition: A hypothetical elementary particle that mediates the force of gravity.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study gravitons to understand how gravity works in the universe.
meanings.sent2: Physicists theorize about the existence of gravitons to explain gravitational interactions.
meanings.sent3: The gravitons at the particle party were the life of the gathering, always pulling everyone together.
meanings.sent4: In the world of physics, gravitons dance around, weaving the fabric of spacetime.
meanings.sent5: Imagine tiny gravitons holding hands, creating the invisible force that keeps us grounded.

meanings.definition: Theoretical particles that are thought to be responsible for transmitting the force of gravity.
meanings.sent1: Some scientists believe that gravitons could be the messengers of gravity between objects.
meanings.sent2: The concept of gravitons helps explain how gravity can act across vast distances.
meanings.sent3: At the science fair, the gravitons booth had a line of curious visitors eager to learn about gravity messengers.
meanings.sent4: Like cosmic couriers, gravitons deliver the message of gravity across the universe.
meanings.sent5: Picture gravitons as tiny carriers of gravitational force, zipping around the cosmos.
